data.title: Our daughter the Bond girl and her very different twin
data.meta_description: She is the actress whose stunning beauty beguiles James Bond in his latest blockbuster adventure, Casino Royale.
data.text:
Top: Eva is Daniel Craig's love interest in Casino Royale. Below: playmates Eva and Joy, in Paris aged six.

11 April 2012

She is the actress whose stunning beauty beguiles James Bond in his latest blockbuster adventure, Casino Royale.

And, as these exclusive pictures show, Eva Green even has the credentials to be a double agent - as she is one of twins.

• Video: Eva on her raunchy sex scene with Daniel Craig • Grumpy Bond: licensed to scowl

• Gallery: James Bond Casino Royale World Premiere

• Casino Royale set to smash box office record

But though the sisters have similar Bond-girl looks, that is where the likenesses end for Eva and her twin, Joy.

For while one has been given a licence to thrill as 007's love interest in the new film, the other prefers the quiet life.

Last week Eva, 26, arrived with her sister in London for the world premiere of the new 007 movie. As the actress basked in the adulation of thousands of fans in Leicester Square, Joy melted into the background.

Now the twins' Swedish father, dentist Walter Green, has spoken for the first time about his daughters and revealed that in spite of their similar looks and upbringing, in temperament and personality they could not be more different.

"They are opposites,' said Walter, 66. "While Eva likes to be in the city, Joy loves the countryside and her horses. They didn't get on as teenagers but Joy is now very proud of Eva. They're very close."

The twins' mother, French actress Marlene Jobert, gave birth to them by Caesarean on July 5, 1980. Eva arrived a minute before Joy.

The girls went to a bilingual school in Paris and spent holidays in England, Ireland and America, perfecting their English.

Read More

'This is my decade': Corrie's Cleaver intends to have 'fun' in her 60s

Ekin-su addresses Davide split on Celebrity Big Brother: 'He hurt me'

Women’s Aid condemns Celebrity Big Brother’s decision to include Gary Goldsmith

Sponsored

Meet the fitness influencer defying stereotypes about ageing

Eva displayed a talent for music and theatre and they both learned to ride but Eva 'didn't have any fun', according to her father. "She was too shaky and didn't have a feeling for horses, whereas Joy loved them."

After leaving school Joy went to business college. She now breeds horses in Normandy with her Italian husband.

Eva studied drama in Paris and then in London, where she won a place at the Webber Douglas drama academy. She made her name with a steamy role in the 2003 Bernardo Bertolucci film The Dreamers.

The film's incest theme provoked a storm of controversy and Eva appeared naked or topless in many scenes. "My sister didn't like it at all,' she later admitted.

Walter also felt uncomfortable with the film. "It was a bit difficult,' he said. "It wasn't really my cup of tea."

But he is a fan of the new Bond movie in which Eva plays agent Vesper Lynd opposite Daniel Craig's Bond.

Walter said: "I was very impressed. Eva has a very nice role. She has had some help from Marlene, who is a very good teacher."

Eva is dating New Zealand actor Marton Csokas, 20, whom she met on the set of the 2005 film Kingdom Of Heaven, and lives in London.
